paper_abstract: This study uses a losing probability f to measure the magnitude of the bulk dissipation of a dissipative Manna model where P(s r L f) the probability distribution of toppling size s on a L x (L/r) square lattice is calculated This approach assumes that the bulk dissipation corresponds to a characteristic length xi The finding xi similar to f(-nu) leads to P(s r L f) = s(-tau) H(s/vertical bar L/A(r)vertical bar(D) vertical bar L/A(r)vertical bar f(nu)) where H is a two-variable universal scaling function r D and v are exponents and A(r) is a nonuniversal metric factor determined by the calculation of moment (C) 2010 Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Universal scaling functions of a dissipative Manna model
